 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹ֫לֶת‎</span><sub>53</sub> **noun feminine**<sup>[[Lev.2.5|Lev 2:5]]</sup> (compare on gender [[BDB#Albr.|Albr]]<sup>ZAW xvi (1896), 106</sup>) ==fine flour== ([[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">σεμίδαλις</span>, [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]] ***simila***) (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סוּלְתָּא‎</span>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***a kind of barley without husks*** [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>1401</sup>; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***sillatu***</u></abbr>, or <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šillatu***</u></abbr>, a kind of grain (?) [[BDB#Meissn|Meissner-Rost]]<sup>BAS iii, 361</sup>; also <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***¾ul¾a, ¾uruti***</u></abbr>, ***flour***, as loan-word in Egyptian, [[BDB#Bondi|Bondi]]<sup>84</sup> [[BDB#WMM|WMM]]<sup>As.u.Eur.101</sup>); — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> [[Gen.18.6|Gen 18:6]] +, construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> [[Exod.29.9|Exod 29:9]] +; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָלְתָּהּ‎</span> [[Lev.2.2|Lev 2:2]] — ***fine flour***, used in king's household [[1Kgs.5.2|1Kgs 5:2]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קֵמַח‎</span>), for honoured guests <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קֶמַח ס‎</span> [[Gen.18.6|Gen 18:6]] ([[BDB#J|J]]), a ***se'ah*** of it sold for a shekel in time of scarcity [[2Kgs.7.1|2Kgs 7:1]]; [[2Kgs.7.16|2Kgs 7:16]]; [[2Kgs.7.18|2Kgs 7:18]] (see [[BDB#Benz|Benz]]); luxurious food [[Ezek.16.13|Ezek 16:13]]; [[Ezek.16.19|Ezek 16:19]] (of Jerusalem under figure of woman); elsewhere only in offerings [[Ezek.46.14|Ezek 46:14]]; [[1Chr.9.29|1Chr 9:29]]; [[1Chr.23.29|1Chr 23:29]], and [[BDB#P|P]]; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חִטִּים‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> [[Exod.29.2|Exod 29:2]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> v[[Exod.29.40|Exod 29:40]], [[Lev.2.1|Lev 2:1]] + 13 t. Leviticus; [[Num.6.15|Num 6:15]] + 26 t. Numbers. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סַם‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סמם‎</span>.
